 Answer all questions. 
 Select the correct or most suitable answer from answer (1), (2), (3), (4) given in questions 1 - 40 
01. An inorganic compound that contributes to build up living matter is, 
1. Vitamin  
2. Nucleic acid  
3. Minerals 
4. Proteins 
02. The compound that breaks down to release energy during cellular respiration, 
1. Glucose  
2. Carbohydrates  
3. Galactose 
4. Sucrose 
03. A laboratory activity which convert sucrose in to glucose is, 
1. Dissolving sugar in water  
2. Combustion of sucrose  
3. Heating sugar with dilute acids  
4. Dissolving sucrose in water and heating. 
04. Consider the following statements regarding nucleic acids. Select the answer with true statements. 
a) Involve in proteins synthesis  
b) Help for the occurrence of variation. 
c) Help to control all biological activities. 
1. Only a 
2. Only b and c 
3. Only a and c 
4. All a,b and c 
05. Water is a major component of the extracurricular fluids that are excreted from living bodies. 
Property of water which mainly responsible for this is. 
1. Coolant property of water  
2. Solvent property of water  
3. Presence of cohesive forces in water 
4. High specific heat capacity of water
06. .Calcium is a mineral contained in the human body and one of its function is, 
1. Important in the absorption of vitamin B 
2. Necessary for  the production of thyroxin hormone  
3. Necessary for the synthesis of hemoglobin 
4. Important to store oxygen in muscle. 
07. 
 A sportsman is running from A to B in a running track. Select the correct 
statement regarding his displacement. 
1. 200m to west 
2. 160m to south east 
3. 160m to west with 700 from north  
4. 700 to north west from north

09. A ball is projected upward with a velocity of 40ms-1 the distance travelled by the ball when it reaches 
half of its maximum height is, 
1. 40m 
2. 60m 
3. 80m 
4. 100m 
10. Maximum number of electrons that can be exist in first four energy levels of an atom is, 
1. 78 
2. 60 
3. 26 
4. 58 
11. Given below are some statements regarding the variation of first lionization energy of elements. 
a) Ionization energy increases from left to right in all period. 
b) Group VIII elements have the highest lionization energy  
c) These values are expressed in joule per mole  
Out of above, true statements are, 
1. Only a and c 
2. Only c 
3. Only b 
4. Only a and b 
12. Metals combine with oxygen to from  
1. Basic oxides 
2. Acidic oxides 
3. Neutral oxides  
4. Amphoteric oxides  
13. A strong acidic compound is, 
1. SiO2 
2. Cl2O7 
3. Mgo 
4. Na2O 
14. The chemical formula for potassium carbonate is 𝐽���2𝐶𝑂3. The formula of the carbonate of element 
which has the valency of 3 is? 
1. 𝑋2(𝐶𝑂3)3  
2. 𝑋2 𝐶𝑂3  
3. 𝑋 𝐶𝑂3  
4. 𝑋3(𝐶𝑂2)2  
15. Incorrect statement regarding the nature of the force is, 
1. Velocity of the object decreases when a force is applied in the direction opposite to the motion. 
2. Resultant due to an applied force varies with its direction. 
3. The unbalanced force required to push a table placed on a smooth surface such as ice is high. 
4. The direction of the force can be indicated by a straight line drawn from the point of application 
of the force.

1. a ∝ F  
 
2. m  ∝ a

17. The correct statement regarding the frictional force is, 
1. The limiting frictional force increases with increasing the normal reaction between surfaces. 
2. If the object doesn't move although the force is applied, a dynamic frictional force acts between 
surfaces. 
3. Frictional force decreases with increasing surface area. 
4. Limiting frictional force is slightly less than dynamic frictional force. 
18. The type of cell that involves in the transportation of oxygen in the human body is, 
1. Nerve cell  
2. Hemoglobin  
3. Red blood cell    
4. Skeletal muscle cell

23. Select the correct statement / s regarding the atomic lattice  
a) Atoms are covalently bonded in this lattice  
b) Some covalent compounds have high boiling points due to their atomic lattice. 
c) Sodium chloride is a naturally existing one such lattice  
1. Only a and b 
2. Only b and c 
3. Only b  
4. All a, b and c 
24. Select the correct statement regarding protists  
1. They are prokaryotic , unicellular or multicellular organisms without specialized tissue. 
2. Most of are photosynthesis  
3. Highly contributes in the decomposition of dead bodies. 
4. Protozoans contribute in the formation of lichens with bacteria. 
25. Small plants that rise horizontally from the basal part of stem under the soil in the plants such as 
paddy, pineapple and kaladuru are known as  
1. Bulbil 
2. Tuber 
3. Suckers  
4. Corm 
26. The action should be done after one week of bud grafting is, 
1. Wrapping the grafted place using polythene strips  
2. Re-wrap the cut inserting the bud more in to the cut 
3. Cutting the stem of the stock about 15cm above from the grafted place. 
4. Remove the wrap and re-wrap keeping the bud open  
27. Inside the ovary are produced with in  
1. Follicles  
2. Cortex 
3. Corpus luteum 
4. Corpus albicans

2. 31603360pa
